intro: Sideroxylon obtusifolium subsp. obtusifolium, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a member of the Burseraceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in terminal panicles, while the fruit is a small, woody capsule containing several seeds. The tree is well adapted to harsh environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and a slow growth rate.
